5 GazeboRetrieve::GazeboRetrieve(ros::NodeHandle nh)
6  : nh_(nh), it_(nh)
7  {
8  // This subscriber will subscribe to odometry messages to get pose information of robot
9  sub1 = nh_.subscribe("odom", 1000, &GazeboRetrieve::odomCallback,this);
10 
11  // This subscriber will subscribe to laser scan messages to get laser sensor data
12  sub2 = nh_.subscribe("base_scan_0", 10, &GazeboRetrieve::laserCallback,this);
13 
14  // This subscriber will subscribe to path messages to get shortest path from 'sample' component
15  sub4 = nh_.subscribe("/path", 10, &GazeboRetrieve::pathCallback,this);
16 
17  //Subscribe map_image/full to get OGMAP, this will be used to calculate percentage of known configuration space
18  image_transport::ImageTransport it(nh);
19  sub3_ = it.subscribe("map_image/full", 1, &GazeboRetrieve::imageCallback,this);
20 
21  //Service for RequestGoal
22  request_goal_client = nh_.serviceClient<a3_help::RequestGoal>("request_goal");
23 
24  //This publisher will publish desired goal state with /chatter topic
25  chatter_pub = nh_.advertise<std_msgs::String>("chatter", 100);
26 
27  //Commands to randomly walk will be published with this publisher
28  velocity_pub = nh_.advertise<geometry_msgs::Twist>("/cmd_vel",1); //TBK_Node publishes RosAria/cmd_vel topic and RosAria node subscribes to it
29 
30  //Get map_size and resolution_ parameters from command line if needed
31  ros::NodeHandle pn("~");
32  double mapSize;
33  double resolution;
34  pn.param<double>("map_size", mapSize, 20.0);
35  pn.param<double>("resolution", resolution, 0.1);
36 
37  pixels_ = (int) mapSize / resolution;
38  std::cout << "size:" << mapSize << " resolution:" << resolution <<
39  " pixels:" << pixels_ << std::endl;
40 
41  // Create an OgMap which is a grayscale (mono) image of size pixels
42  image_ = cv::Mat::zeros(pixels_,pixels_, CV_8UC1);
43  count_ =0;
44  cv::waitKey(30);
45 
46  //Initialize random seed
47  srand (time(NULL));
48 
49  //Initialize different parameters for random walk
50  minfrontdistance = 0.750;
51  speed = 0.200;
52  avoidspeed = 0; // -150;
53  turnrate = 40*M_PI/180;
54 
55  randint;
56  randcount = 0;
57  avoidcount = 0;
58  obs = false;
59 
60  // Go into read-think-act loop
61  newturnrate=0.0f;
62  newspeed=0.0f;
63 
64  //Start this object as discovery and random walk active
65  active_discovery = true;
66  continue_to_walk = true;
67  }

74  void GazeboRetrieve::pathCallback(const geometry_msgs::PoseArrayConstPtr& msg){
76  ROS_INFO("Path Message is Received");
77 
78  //Dump incoming path data for debug purposes
79  for (unsigned int i=0; i < msg->poses.size(); i++){
80  std::cout << "Point_" << i << "_on Path // Col:" << msg->poses[i].position.x << " Row:" << msg->poses[i].position.y << std::endl;
81  }
82  }
83 
84  void GazeboRetrieve::imageCallback(const sensor_msgs::ImageConstPtr& msg){
86 
87  //This variable shows percentage of free+occupied pixels on total OGMAP
88  double discovered_percentage = 0;
89 
90  //bridge incoming message to cvPtr_ securely, otherwise throw exception
91  try{
92  if (enc::isColor(msg->encoding))
93  cvPtr_ = cv_bridge::toCvCopy(msg, enc::BGR8);
94  else
95  cvPtr_ = cv_bridge::toCvCopy(msg, enc::MONO8);
96  }
97  catch (cv_bridge::Exception& e){
98  ROS_ERROR("cv_bridge exception: %s", e.what());
99  return;
100  }
101 
102  //Get size of the current OGMAP
103  int size_y = cvPtr_->image.rows;
104  int size_x = cvPtr_->image.cols;
105 
106  //This variable will be used to count free and occupied cells in OGMAP
107  int counter = 0;
108 
109  //If discovery phase is enabled
110  if(active_discovery){
111  //sweep whole pixels in OGMAP to count free and occupied cells
112  for (int y = 0; y < size_y; y++){
113  for (int x = 0; x < size_x; x++){
114  switch ((int)cvPtr_->image.at<uchar>(x, y)){
115  //if pixel value is 255:free or 0:occupied increment counter, otherwise don't
116  case 255:
117  case 0:
118  counter++;
119  break;
120 
121  case 127:
122  default:
123  break;
124  }
125  }
126  }
127 
128  //Calculate discovered percentage of actual map with actual size of 6.27x15,7[m] and 0.1[m] resolution
129  discovered_percentage = (counter*100)/9844;
130 
131  //Dump calculated percentage for debug purposes
132  std::cout << "Discovered Percentage: %" << discovered_percentage << std::endl;
133 
134  // When robot discover the working space more than %80, stop random walk process and publish goal state
135  if(discovered_percentage > 80.0){
136  //This string and string strema will be used to publish comma seperated goal state with /chatter topic
137  std_msgs::String msg;
138  std::stringstream ss;
139 
140  //Request Goal service from a3_help component
141  a3_help::RequestGoal srv;
142 
143  //Stop walking on the map randomly
144  continue_to_walk = false;
145 
146  //Request a random goal point from service
147  srv.request.x = rand() % size_x ;
148  srv.request.y = rand() % size_y;
149 
150  //Check that if we can successfully request this service
151  if (request_goal_client.call(srv)){
152  //If responde to this request is ack
153  if(srv.response.ack){
154  //Compose comma seperated msg content with desired goal state
155  ROS_INFO("Goal Request Confirmed");
156  ss << srv.request.x << "," << srv.request.y;
157  msg.data = ss.str();
158  //Publish this message with /chatter topic
159  chatter_pub.publish(msg);
160  active_discovery = false;
161  }
162  else{
163  //If we cannot get an ack from service provider, try again on next callback
164  ROS_INFO("Invalid Goal State");
165  std::this_thread::sleep_for (std::chrono::milliseconds(50));
166  }
167  }
168  else{
169  //If we cannot succesfully request service, try again on next callback
170  ROS_INFO("Failed to call service request_goal");
171  std::this_thread::sleep_for (std::chrono::milliseconds(50));
172  }
173  }
174  }
175 
176  //Lock imageBuffer for secure write
177  imageBuffer.buffer_mutex_.lock();
178  //Push new image and timestamp to buffer
179  imageBuffer.imageDeq.push_back(cvPtr_->image);
180  imageBuffer.timeStampDeq.push_back(msg->header.stamp);
181  //If there is more than two images release the oldest image from buffer
182  if(imageBuffer.imageDeq.size()>2){
183  imageBuffer.imageDeq.pop_front();
184  imageBuffer.timeStampDeq.pop_front();
185  }
186  imageBuffer.buffer_mutex_.unlock();
187 
188  }

193  void GazeboRetrieve::odomCallback(const nav_msgs::OdometryConstPtr& msg){
195 
196  //Define local pose variable to get position data from msg
197  geometry_msgs::Pose pose=msg->pose.pose;
198 
199  //Lock buffer first, to write safely
200  buffer.buffer_mutex_.lock();
201  buffer.poseDeq.push_back(pose);
202  buffer.timeStampDeq.push_back(msg->header.stamp);
203  //If there are more than 2 position data on buffer, delete oldest one
204  if(buffer.poseDeq.size()>2){
205  buffer.poseDeq.pop_front();
206  buffer.timeStampDeq.pop_front();
207  }
208  //Unlock buffer
209  buffer.buffer_mutex_.unlock();
210  }

212 
213 
214  void GazeboRetrieve::laserCallback(const sensor_msgs::LaserScanConstPtr& msg){
216 
217  //Initialize closest_point variable with range_max from incoming message
218  double closest_point=msg->range_max;
219  double angle=0;
220  double x,y;
221 
222  //Sweep all message components to find closest point within range
223  for (unsigned int idx=0 ; idx < msg->ranges.size() ; idx++){
224  if(msg->ranges.at(idx)<closest_point){
225  closest_point=msg->ranges.at(idx);
226  angle=msg->angle_min+(idx*msg->angle_increment);
227  }
228  }
229 
230  //Get Timestamp
231  ros::Time timeLaser = msg->header.stamp;
232 
233  //Find x,y values of closest point
234  x = closest_point * cos(angle);
235  y = closest_point * sin(angle);
236 
237  //Dump message for debug purposes
238  //std::cout << timeLaser << " L: [d,theta,x,y]=[" << closest_point << "," << angle << "," << x << "," << y << "]" << std::endl;
239 
240  //Initialze 'obstacle found' with false
241  obs = false;
242  for (unsigned int i = 0; i < msg->ranges.size(); i++){
243  //If any of the points in lase message is closer than minimum distance than assign obs=true
244  if(msg->ranges.at(i) < minfrontdistance){
245  obs = true;
246  break;
247  }
248  }
249 
250  //If obs or avoidcount is different from zero
251  if(obs || avoidcount ){
252  newspeed = avoidspeed;
253  // once we start avoiding, continue avoiding for 2 seconds
254  // (we run at about 10Hz, so 20 loop iterations is about 2 sec)
255  if(!avoidcount){
256  //Reset avoid counter to 15 and randcount to zero
257  avoidcount = 15;
258  randcount = 0;
259  //Start to turn to other side
260  if(msg->ranges.at(msg->ranges.size()-1) < msg->ranges.at(0))
261  newturnrate = -turnrate;
262  else
263  newturnrate = turnrate;
264  }
265  avoidcount--;
266  }
267  else{
268  avoidcount = 0;
269  newspeed = speed;
270  // update turnrate every 3 seconds
271  if(!randcount){
272  // make random int tween -20 and 20
273  //randint = (1+(int)(40.0*rand()/(RAND_MAX+1.0))) - 20;
274  randint = rand() % 41 - 20;
275  newturnrate = randint*M_PI/180.0;
276  randcount = 20;
277  }
278  randcount--;
279  }
280  }
281 
282 
283  void GazeboRetrieve::seperateThread(){
285 
286  double yaw,x,y;
288  ros::Time timeOdom = ros::Time::now();;
289  while (ros::ok()) {
290  //If random walk flag is still true
291  if(continue_to_walk){
292  // write commands to robot
293  cmdvel.linear.x = newspeed;
294  cmdvel.angular.z = newturnrate;
295 
296  //Publish this command with velocity_pub publisher
297  velocity_pub.publish(cmdvel);
298  std::this_thread::sleep_for (std::chrono::milliseconds(10));
299  }
300  //If random walk flag is down, i.e. we are discovered at least %80 of map
301  else{
302  //Stop robot
303  cmdvel.linear.x = 0;
304  cmdvel.angular.z = 0;
305  velocity_pub.publish(cmdvel);
306  break;
307  }
308  }
309  }
